messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
I'm on the freeway between Hurricane and Colorado City.
Okay, so you're on SR 59, I believe?
Yes.
What mile marker?
I don't know. I'm pulled over in the road.
My husband's in the middle of the road having a serious, like, psychosis.
Okay, do you know what mile marker at all?
I have no idea.
And is he being violent right now?
He's taking his clothes off, he's running in this street.
What's the phone number you're calling from in case we get disconnected?
Brian, pick up your shirt.
Okay, and what is he saying? What's he doing?
He's freaking out.
Okay. Do you know what's going on?
No!
How old is he?
Oh my God. Please, just try to jump in front of a car or something.
He tried to jump in front of a car?
Yes.
Stop, stop, stop! Stop, Brian! You're going to get hurt, please.
Ma'am, what is your name?
My name is Anna Cardo. Will you please get in the car, Brian? Please.
Ann, I need you to talk to me, okay?
I'm sorry. I'm just afraid he's going to jump in front of the car.
I understand. Does he have any weapons?
No.
Has he been drinking?
No, no.
Has anybody been doing any drugs?
No. Brian, knock it off. Brian, go. He's just throwing things. I'm afraid he's going to...
What is your husband's name?
Brian.
Brian, what's his last name?
B-A-R-D-A-L-L.
Ann, is your vehicle in the roadway or is it off to the side?
My daughter's in the car, and I'm afraid he's going to jump in front of a car or something.
Okay, Ann, is your vehicle in the roadway or is it off to the side?
It's off to the side. He's just having a freak out.
I've given him his medicine, but it's going to take about an hour to kick in.
Okay, what kind of mental illness does he have?
He's been diagnosed as bipolar.
Okay, how long ago did you give him the medicine?
About 15 minutes ago. My daughter's in the car, and I'm afraid he's going to...
Okay, can you spell your husband's last name again?
B-A-R-D-A-L-L.
Just come fast. I'm so scared.
They're coming as fast as they can. Okay, try to stay calm. Are you able to stay at a safe distance?
Yes, but he's running in the road.
Okay, Ann, is he thinking about committing suicide?
No, I don't think so.
Has he injured your daughter at all?
No, no. Brian, stop!
He's not listening. Just sit down, please.
Ann, the right people are coming. They're coming as fast as they can.
I'm so scared. I can't do this.
Ann, if it's safe to do so, I want you to try to get your daughter out of the car.
No, I can't. She's locked in the car. I'm keeping her in there so he can't get in.
Brian, get out of the road!
What direction is he going?
Up and down all around. He's directing traffic.
Stay out of the road, sweetie.
They're coming lights and sirens as fast as they can.
Help is on the way.
Ann, if you can, keep your daughter safe and in the car.
Try to stay calm.
I'm really scared he's going to jump in front of a moving car.
I don't want you to go out into traffic to try to stop him. Just stay with your daughter.
I'm very concerned. Please hurry.
The officers are on their way. They're coming as fast as possible.
He's still running across the road.
Try to keep him safe until help arrives. Can you get other cars to slow down or stop?
People are pulling over to help, but he's freaking out on them.
Ann, can you spell your last name for me again, please?
C-A-R-D-O.
Ann, what is your home address?
1945 West University Heights Drive North in Flagstaff, Arizona.
What is the zip code?
What's your date of birth?
And your husband's date of birth?
You're doing a good job, Ann. The officers will be there soon.
I'm just so scared.
They're coming as fast as they can, lights and sirens.
He's running up and down the road.
Stay at a safe distance and keep your daughter inside the car.
He's chasing cars now.
The police are almost there.
He's naked and not listening.
Keep yourself and your daughter safe.
I see the police! They're here.
They're there? All right, I'm going to let you go now. You did a great job, Ann.
Thank you.
Ann, mile marker 18 on SR 59?
Yes, heading towards Hilldale.
Okay, we'll let them know. Thank you.
Thank you. Bye-bye.
I'm out here on the highway going toward Hilldale, and there's a guy out here running around like he's crazy. He's stopping cars and stuff.
And you're on SR-59? Can you tell what mile marker you're at?
I don't know, ma'am. It's about five or six miles out of Hurricane.
Five to six miles out of Hurricane and it's a male acting crazy?
Oh, he's going crazy out here, and I stopped, and his wife or his girlfriend said he... He's about six foot tall, has a beard, no shirt, black shorts.
Black shorts? Okay, and is he saying anything specific?
He flagged me down and then his girlfriend said he was going crazy.
Did he say his name?
He didn't, ma'am.
Hold on one second, okay? Don't hang up on me.
Okay.
